title: Brighton beat Everton in dramatic circumstances - in match featuring first VAR-awarded penalty of season
text:
Despite their misfortune here, Everton’s miserable away form continues and the pressure on Marco Silva won’t go away.

With ten minutes remaining, the Toffees looked to have secured back-to-back victories which would have moved them into the top half of the table.​

Instead, they are just two points off the bottom three ahead of a crucial League Cup tie at home to Silva’s former club Watford on Tuesday after the first penalty of the season to be awarded by the video assistant referee went against them.​

Players and management looked on in disbelief as Lee Mason instructed referee Andy Madley to award the kick after an innocuous coming together between Aaron Connolly and Michael Keane in which Keane appeared to have stepped on his toe.​

“We were winning the game and one decision that was tough decided the game,” said a frustrated Silva, who added that Richarlison should have been awarded a penalty 15 minutes earlier.​
